summary: Melbourne is Australia's second-largest city, located in the state of Victoria. It has a population of 5.2 million people, often called Melburnians. The city was founded in 1835 and named after William Lamb, the British Prime Minister at the time. Melbourne became the capital of Victoria in 1851 and experienced a big growth period during the gold rush. It is known for its diverse culture, with many people from different countries living there. Melbourne has iconic buildings, like the Royal Exhibition Building, and famous places like the Melbourne Cricket Ground. It is also known for its sports events, art, and music.
title: Melbourne
